I haven't played this game before 2020. 16 years after release, and it still feels fresh. The gunplay is pretty tight, the puzzles and map design are amazing, and the storyline is still super interesting. Playing through it now makes me wonder why I waited so long to pick this up after buying it back in 2014

With this Coronavirus stay at home madness going on, I decided to start playing some game that were on my Steam library, Since I never played any of the half life games, and I unfortunately didn't have the first Half Life, so I decided to play this game instead. I will say, this game is amazing! The story is really strong even through I had very little knowledge of the game(besides from what I had learned from youtube videos). The game made me really want to just sit down and fully play through the game. The graphics in the game is amazing even through its an old game. I would for sure recommend this game if you are wanting to just sit down and just play through a game. 10/10

JUST, AMAZING! 

Continues on greatly from the first half life storyline, the nuclear blast from black mesa apparently attracts the combine (universal union is the actual name, according to dr breen), then gordon is awaken by gman, he then goes on to free humanity from the combine, but with losses and consequences on the way. I really do recommend this game, awesome storyline and great atmosphere, want to find out more about the story? Buy this game and get it, it's just one of the best half life games, they really amped up the realism in this one compared to Half Life 1, and I really look forward to playing Half Life: Alyx when I get it!

As someone who only recently delved into the Half-Life series I think that I can easily say that this game and its predecessor stands the test of time. Starting with Half Life one more than a couple of months back I was awed at the world that was being developed before my eyes and with it's conclusion instantly wanted to delve deeper into the lure of it. I quickly booted up Half life two after finishing Half Life one and was instantly amazed to see how far the series had come in such a short period of time. After being introduced to the combine I was already being further sucked into this crazy, near-future, Sci-Fi world of half life. With this games conclusion and all it's expansions I must say that as a newcomer to the half life series this is a masterpiece. It's no question that these games deserve the acclaim that they've received over the years. To people looking to get into the half life series or a new single player experience in general I would strongly recommend this series. I think I can speak on the behalf of most players when I say that I wish I could go back and experience my first time playing these games so I most certainly think you'll enjoy yours. - 10/10 would cherish again.

What a great game. Its amazing how much this game has held up over the years. I played source games my whole life but half-life 2. It was so cool doing where all the classic guns, animators, character models, sounds, and props came from. The gun play was fun and the game threw different scenarios at the player to mix it up. The beginning was a fun introduction and warm up to the game play. The middle when you break into the prison was by far the most fun. By the end the game play of running around and shooting things did get a little bit repetitive but it was still a blast. Overall I would give this game a 8/10 to play in today's market. All around an enjoyable experience and a must play if you have played other source games.

I have to say, HalfLife2 wasn't a lot of fun for me to play, and here is why:

[TL/DR: I thought I never played through HL2, cause when I played through HL1, OpposingForce, BlueShift, BlackMesa and now HL2 again the last few weeks I could remember nearly nothing from HL2, but I actually played it before! This shows how boring the game actually is that I forgot EVERYTHING from it, while I remembered most levels from HL1 which is even longer ago that I played it.]


I love the hell out of Half Life 1 and Opposing Force, aswell as HL1 Remake "BlackMesa"

But Half Life 2 lacks so much that the world of HalfLife 1 offered.

Half Life 1 was a great game because of this super interesting and exciting to explore research Station Black Mesa which is an whole eco system of it's own.
It was exciting because of the very interesting and different Aliens to discover and fight. The strange BossFight Puzzles and all of the interesting different Weapons. 
Overall HL1 feels different the whole time you play through because of the interesting level Design.

But HL2 DOESN'T share any of those points.

The Levels you walk through are mostly just boring rural areas or some open shore areas. There is NOTHING interesting or exciting about them.
And they feel repetitive very fast. Even Reavenholm which is at least something else feels like doing the same for too long after 15min in

For the whole game you only fight pretty much 3 different enemies: Combine, Headcrabs/Headcrab Zombies. And Striders/Hunter Helicopters.

It get's boring fast!

Weapons are very basic. The gravity Gun is at least for me not as entertatining as many claim 


The first quarter of the game is mostly just running away from the combine which you aren't allowed to fight back cause either they are just retarded endless spawns or you haven't got the weapons or amunition to fight the HunterHelis. 

Driving the Buggy or Speed Boat is also nothing thrilling.

Overall many episodes of the game feel rather stressfull and no fun cause you are constantly just running away from endless spawn enemies till you reach a point were you finally are allowed to fight them (Rocket ammo boxes). Or you are allowed to fight the waves of combine, but it is seriously just WAVE after WAVE of combines like a stupid shooting range. 

There is not much more to say, sadly
